div.p: The 7 value sets that are used to test the API functionality span common extensional and intensional definition styles and consequences.
Suite 4: A set of membership tests for valueset #2. This suite is checking the various ways that the operation can be invoked. Overview of value sets:

ul.li: extensional-case-1: An enumeration of codes from a FHIR defined code system
extensional-case-2: An enumeration of codes from LOINC
extensional-case-3: An enumeration of codes from SNOMED
extensional-case-4: An enumeration of codes the crosses code systems, with codes from a FHIR defined value set and the V3 Role code system
intensional-case-1: A selection of codes from LOINC by their system value
intensional-case-2: A selection of codes from SNOMED based on subsumption
intensional-case-3: All clinical findings from SNOMED (based on subsumption) - a value set that is too large to expand

name.value: FHIR Connectathon 22 - Terminology Services - Validate Code Optional - JSON

description.value: FHIR Connectathon 22 - Terminology Services - Validate Code Optional - JSON Format - A set of membership validation tests with API variations for each of the 7 ValueSet fixtures. These tests check for API surface variations. All tests are the same as the first, but test different ways of passing the code. There is no setup and teardown as all ValueSet resources are expected to exist on the target system under test.

name.value: Test 01-a Validate extensional-case-1 valid - system/code/display url parameters

description.value: Check that the code {http://hl7.org/fhir/administrative-gender}male is in the value set.
Test $validate-code operation on ValueSet extensional-case-1 for a valid code.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Parameters.
Confirm that the returned Parameters minimally contains the information in validate-code-valid-min.
